post_message: Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials have yet to release details on how many people agents arrested Thursday, but advocates say more than 100 immigrants were taken into custody as ICE conducted home raids in Santa Paula, Oxnard, Van Nuys, Downey and San Bernardino. Those detained were either illegal immigrants with deportation orders but no criminal background, or family members of those sought who were home during the raids and told officials they lacked documentation, according to the Coalition for Humane Immigrant Rights of Los Angeles.
